group.groupDescription: This group contains functions related to whole system (all servers).

function.name: getResourceTypes
function.description: Read all resource types. Resource type contain object type such as 'Server', 'Camera' e.t.c. Also, resource types contain additional information for cameras such as maximum fps, resolution, e.t.c

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getResourceParams
function.description: Read resource (camera, user or server) additional parameters (camera firmware version, e.t.c). List of parameters depends of resource type.

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getMediaServersEx
function.description: Return server list

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getCamerasEx
function.description: Read camera list

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

result.caption: Returns camera list data formatted in a requested format

attribute.name: addParams
attribute.description: List of additional parameters for camera. This list can contain such information as full ONVIF url, camera maximum fps e.t.c

attribute.name: audioEnabled
attribute.description: Server will push audio stream from a camera if parameter is true

attribute.name: controlEnabled
attribute.description: Server will manage camera (change resolution, fps, create profiles e.t.c) if parameter if true

attribute.name: dewarpingParams
attribute.description: Json string with dewarping parameters

attribute.name: groupId
attribute.description: Internal group identifier. It is used for grouping channels for multi-channels cameras together.

attribute.name: groupName
attribute.description: Group name. This name can be changed by user

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Object ID. All ID for all objects in a system is GUIDs

attribute.name: login
attribute.description: Login for camera authentication

attribute.name: mac
attribute.description: camera MAC address

attribute.name: manuallyAdded
attribute.description: True if user added camera manually

attribute.name: maxArchiveDays
attribute.description: Maximum archive duration in days for this camera. If value less or equal to zero, it is not used

attribute.name: minArchiveDays
attribute.description: Minimum archive duration in days for this camera. If value less or equal to zero, it is not used

attribute.name: model
attribute.description: Camera model

attribute.name: motionMask
attribute.description: Camera's motion mask. This string defines several rectangles via ':' delimiter. Each rectangle is described by 5 digits: sensitivity, x,y(for left top corner), width, height

attribute.name: motionType
attribute.description: If value is 'MT_SoftwareGrid' then server determine motion, otherwise camera built-in motion will be used

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Camera name

attribute.name: parentId
attribute.description: Camera's server ID

attribute.name: physicalId
attribute.description: Camera unique identifier. This identifier is used in all requests related to a camera. For instance, in RTSP requests

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: Password for camera authentication

attribute.name: scheduleEnabled
attribute.description: Do record camera archive if true

attribute.name: scheduleTasks
attribute.description: List of 'scheduleTask' objects with camera recording schedule.

attribute.name: secondaryStreamQuality
attribute.description: Secondary stream quality. Possible values:'SSQualityLow', 'SSQualityMedium', 'SSQualityHigh', 'SSQualityDontUse'

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Camera status. Possible values are: 'Offline', 'Online', 'Recording'

attribute.name: statusFlags
attribute.description: Usually this field is zero. Non zero value is used to mark that a lot of network issues was occurred with this camera

attribute.name: typeId
attribute.description: Unique ID with camera's type. Camera's type can describe predefined information such as camera maximum resolution, fps e.t.c. Detailed type information can be obtained via 'getResourceTypes' request.

attribute.name: url
attribute.description: Camera plain IP address or full http url if camera was added manually. Also, for multichannel encoders full url is used

attribute.name: vendor
attribute.description: Camera manufacturer

function.name: getCameraHistoryItems
function.description: Read information about which server hold camera in some time period. This information is used for archive play if camera was moved from one server to another.

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getCameraBookmarkTags
function.description: Reserved for future use

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getBusinessRules
function.description: Return business rules

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getUsers
function.description: Return users registered in the system. User's password contain MD5 hash data with salt

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getVideowalls
function.description: Return list of video walls

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getLayouts
function.description: Return list of user layout

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: listDirectory
function.description: Return list of folders and files in a virtual FS stored inside database. This function is used to add files (such audio for notifications) to database.

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

param.name: folder
param.description: Folder name in a virtual FS

function.name: getStoredFile
function.description: Read file data from a virtual FS

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getSettings
function.description: Read general system settings such as email address e.t.c

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getCurrentTime
function.description: Read current time

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getFullInfo
function.description: Read all data such as all servers, cameras, users e.t.c

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

function.name: getLicenses
function.description: Read license list

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of hierarchical structure only top level data will be provided

group.groupDescription: This group contains functions related to a single server

function.name: execAction
function.description: Execute business action. Action data should be in a internal binary format. This method is going to be refactored at next version.

result.caption: Return XML with 'OK' message or error code

function.name: events
function.description: Returns event log in proprietary binary format

param.name: from
param.description: Start of time period at ms since 1.1.1970 (UTC format).

param.name: to
param.description: End of time period at ms since 1.1.1970 (UTC format).

result.caption: Return server event log in proprietary binary format

function.name: doCameraDiagnosticsStep
function.description: Performs camera diagnostics.

value.name: cameraAvailability
value.description: Checks if camera is accessible from the server

value.name: mediaStreamAvailability
value.description: Checks if camera media stream can be opened

function.name: setCameraParam
function.description: Sets values of several camera parameters. This parameters are used on the Advanced tab in camera settings. For instance: brightness, contrast e.t.c.

param.name: <any name>
param.description: Parameter for camera to set. Request can contains one or more parameters to set.

result.caption: Returns OK if all parameters have been set, otherwise returns error 500 (Internal server error) and result of setting for every parameter.

function.name: getCameraParam
function.description: Read camera parameters. For instance: brightness, contrast e.t.c. Parameters to read should be specified.

param.name: <any name>
param.description: Parameter name to read. Request can contains one or more parameters.

result.caption: Returns required parameter values in form of paramName=paramValue, each parameter on new line

function.name: image
function.description: Return image from camera

param.name: time
param.description: required image time. Microseconds since 1970 UTC or string in format 'YYYY-MM-DDThh24:mi:ss.zzz'. Date format is auto detected. Also, additional special values are allowed.

value.name: NOW
value.description: Live position (no frame is returned if camera is offline

value.name: LATEST
value.description: last frame from camera (return live position or last frame from archive if camera is offline)

param.name: method
param.description: Parameter defines method to search frame inside GOP structure. Default value 'before'. Parameter not used for Motion jpeg video codec.

value.name: before
value.description: Returns nearest I-frame before specified time.

value.name: after
value.description: Returns nearest I-frame after specified time.

value.name: exact
value.description: Get image for exact time position. It required more CPU.

param.name: height
param.description: Required image height. By default image have same size as source video stream. If only height is specified width is auto detected

param.name: width
param.description: Required image width. By default image have same size as source video stream. width cannot be specified without specifying height

function.name: showLog
function.description: Returns tail of the server log file

result.caption: Tail of the server log file in text format

function.name: manualCamera/search
function.description: Search cameras in manual mode

param.name: start_ip
param.description: First IP address in range to scan.

param.name: end_ip
param.description: Last IP address in range to scan.

param.name: port
param.description: Camera(s) port to check. Port is auto-detected if parameter is absent.

result.caption: XML with camera names, manufacturers and urls.

function.name: manualCamera/status
function.description: Get manual adding progress.

function.name: manualCamera/stop
function.description: Stop manual adding progress.

result.caption: XML with OK message or error code.

function.name: manualCamera/add
function.description: Manual add camera(s). If several cameras are added, parameters 'url' and 'manufacturer' must be defined several times.

param.name: url
param.description: Camera url returned by scan request.

result.caption: XML with OK message or error code.

function.name: ping
function.description: Ping the server

result.caption: JSON with error code, error string and module unique ID in case of successful ping.

function.name: pingSystem
function.description: Ping the system.

result.caption: JSON with error code, error string and module information in case of successful ping. Error string could be empty in case of successful ping, "FAIL" if the specified system is unreachable or there is no any system, "UNAUTHORIZED" if the authentication credentials are invalid, and "INCOMPATIBLE" if the found system has incompatible version or different customization.

function.name: ptz
function.description: Perform reading or writing PTZ operation

value.name: ContinuousMovePtzCommand
value.description: Start PTZ continues move. Parameters xSpeed, ySpeed and zSpeed are used in range [-1.0..+1.0]. To stop moving use value 0 for all parameters.

value.name: ContinuousFocusPtzCommand
value.description: Start PTZ focus in or out. Parameter speed defines speed and focus direction in range [-1.0..+1.0].

value.name: AbsoluteDeviceMovePtzCommand
value.description: Move camera to absolute position. Parameters xPos, yPos and zPos are used in range defined by camera. Parameter speed is used in range [0..1.0].

value.name: AbsoluteLogicalMovePtzCommand
value.description: Move camera to absolute position. Parameters xPos, yPos range are: [-180..+180]. Parameter zPos range is: [0..180] (field of view in degree). Parameters speed range is: [0..1.0].

value.name: GetDevicePositionPtzCommand
value.description: Read camera current position. Return parameters xPos, yPos and zPos in range defined by camera.

value.name: GetLogicalPositionPtzCommand
value.description: Read camera current position. Return parameters xPos, yPos in range [-180..+180]. Return parameter zPos in range [0..180] (field of view in degree).

value.name: CreatePresetPtzCommand
value.description: Create PTZ preset. Parameter presetId defines internal preset name. Parameter presetName defines display preset name.

value.name: UpdatePresetPtzCommand
value.description: Update PTZ preset display name. Parameter presetId defines internal preset name. Parameter presetName defines display preset name.

value.name: RemovePresetPtzCommand
value.description: Update PTZ preset display name. Parameter presetId defines internal preset name

value.name: ActivatePresetPtzCommand
value.description: Go to PTZ preset. Parameter presetId defines internal preset name. Parameter speed defines move speed in range [0..1.0.]

result.caption: Json message with error code and error message.

function.name: rebuildArchive
function.description: Start or stop server archive rebuilding.

result.caption: Rebuild progress if no input parameter specified or XML with OK message or error code.

function.name: RecordedTimePeriods
function.description: Recorded chunk info by specified cameras.

param.name: physicalId
param.description: Camera unique ID. Parameter can be used several times to define a list of cameras.

param.name: startTime
param.description: Start time of a time interval. Microseconds since 1970 UTC or string in format 'YYYY-MM-DDThh24:mi:ss.zzz'. format is auto detected.

param.name: endTime
param.description: End time of a time interval. Microseconds since 1970 UTC or string in format 'YYYY-MM-DDThh24:mi:ss.zzz'. format is auto detected.

param.name: filter
param.description: This parameter is used for motion search (periodsType must be 1). Match motion on a video by specified rectangle. Filter format is: <rect1>;<rect2>;<rectN> rectangle format is: <x,y,width,height> All values are measured in relative portions of a video frame. 'x' and 'width' in range [0..43], 'y' and 'height' in range [0..31].

param.name: format
param.description: Data format. Allowed values: 'json', 'xml', 'txt', 'bin'. Default value 'json'

param.name: detail
param.description: Chunk detail level, in microseconds. Time periods/chunks that are shorter than the detail level are discarded. You can use detail level as amount of microseconds per screen pixel.

value.description: Only chunk with motion (parameter motionRegions required)

result.caption: Chunks data in requested format. Chunks are merged for all requested cameras. Time and duration defined in UTC milliseconds.

function.name: statistics
function.description: Returns server info: CPU usage, HDD usage e.t.c.

function.name: storageSpace
function.description: Returns a list of all server storages.

function.name: storageStatus
function.description: Check if specified folder can be used as a server storage.

result.caption: JSON data. 'OK' if specified folder may be used for writing on the server. Otherwise returns 'FAIL'

function.name: gettime
function.description: Returns server UTC time, time zone and authentication realm (realm is added for convenience)

function.name: activateLicense
function.description: Activate new license and return license JSON data if success

function.name: installUpdate
function.description: Updates server by the package contained in POST body

function.name: installUpdate
function.description: Install update from zip package which should be in the request body.

function.name: onEvent
function.description: Process business event from external system. Reserved for future use.

function.name: discoveredPeers
function.description: Returns a list of the discovered peers.

param.name: showAddresses
param.description: Set it to true to show server addresses.

result.caption: JSON with a list of the discovered peers

function.name: restart
function.description: Restart the server.

function.name: moduleInformation
function.description: Get information about the server.

param.name: allModules
param.description: Set it to true to get all modules from the system.

param.name: showAddresses
param.description: Set it to true to show server addresses.

function.name: moduleInformationAuthenticated
function.description: The same as moduleInformation but requires authentication. Useful to test connection.

function.name: configure
function.description: Configure server parameters.

param.name: systemName
param.description: New system name for the server.

param.name: wholeSystem
param.description: Flag shows if the specified system name must be set to the all servers in the system.

result.caption: JSON with error code and flag "restartNeeded" that shows if the server must be restarted to apply settings. Error string contains a hint to identify a problem: SYSTEM_NAME, PORT or PASSWORD.

function.name: mergeSystems
function.description: Merge two systems.

param.name: url
param.description: URL of one server in the system to join.

param.name: password
param.description: Administrator password of the target system.

param.name: currentPassword
param.description: Administrator password of the current system.

value.name: true
value.description: The current system will get system name and administrator password of the target system.

value.name: false
value.description: The target system will get system name and administrator password of the current system.

result.caption: JSON with error code and error string. Error string could be empty in case of successful ping, "FAIL" if the specified system is unreachable or there is no any system, "UNAUTHORIZED" if the authentication credentials are invalid, "INCOMPATIBLE" if the found system has incompatible version or different customization, and "BACKUP_ERROR" if database backup could not been created.

function.name: backupDatabase
function.description: Backup server database.

group.groupDescription: This group contains information about accessing cameras' live video and footage.

function.name: <physicalId>
function.caption: RTSP Streaming
function.description: Open RTSP video from a camera. It is not an exact method name. It means that RTSP url may contain any camera unique ID. For instance: rtsp://<server_ip>:<port>/12AB42FD5912?pos=1235631&resolution=240p

param.name: pos
param.description: By default server opens camera from live position. This parameter defines position in an archive in milliseconds since epoch, microseconds since epoch or text date in ISO fomat (e.g., 2015-07-30T12:00:00). Position can be passed via standard RTSP attribute as well as via URL parameter

param.name: resolution
param.description: Turn on video transcoding to the specified resolution. Resolution string either may contain width and height (for instance 320x240) or height only (for instance 240p)

param.name: rotation
param.description: Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degree. If parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog. Parameter take place if video transcoding is activated (parameter codec and/or parameter resolution are presents.)

param.name: codec
param.description: Defines video codec used for transcoding. Default value H263.

param.name: stream
param.description: Open high quality stream if parameter is 0 or low quality stream if parameter is 1. By default server auto detect preferred stream index based on destination resolution.

param.name: speed
param.description: Playback speed. Only values in range [1..32] are supported. Default value is 1.

function.name: media/<physicalId>.<format>
function.caption: HTTP Streaming
function.description: Url format for opening camera stream using HTTP protocol. Codec and stream format can be specified in url parameters. Live stream and archive can be downloaded. If required and possible, media stream transcoding is performed on-the-fly. Stream format can be one of following: webm, mpegts, mp4, 3gp, mpjpeg (motion jpeg) Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/media/12AB42FD5912.webm

param.name: resolution
param.description: Video stream resolution. Example: 720x576, 1920x1080, 720p, 1080p. By default, 640x480 is used

param.name: pos
param.description: If present and not equal to <now>, specifies archive stream start positions milliseconds since epoch (1970-01-01 00:00, UTC), microseconds since epoch or text date in ISO fomat (e.g., 2015-07-30T12:00:00). Otherwise, LIVE stream is provided

param.name: rotation
param.description: Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degree. If parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog

param.name: sfd
param.description: Stand Frame Duration. If parameter is present, video speed is limited by real time.

function.name: hls/<physicalId>.m3u
function.caption: HLS Streaming
function.description: Url format for opening camera stream with Http Live Streaming (HLS). This protocol is supported by iOS-based devices (iPhone, iPad). Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/hls/12AB42FD5912.m3u

param.name: pos
param.description: Camera archive position to open. Can be: date/time in ISO format, server time zone (example: 2015-02-20T19:00), milliseconds since epoch (1970-01-01 00:00, UTC) or microseconds since epoch

param.name: hi
param.description: If specified, only hi quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

param.name: lo
param.description: If specified, only low quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

function.name: hls/<physicalId>.<format>
function.caption: Direct download
function.description: Url format for downloading fragment of archive by specifying fragment start time and duration. Fragment can be downloaded in mpeg-2/ts (.ts) format or matroska (.mkv). No transcoding is done. Stream format can be one of following: ts, mkv Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/hls/12AB42FD5912.mkv?startDatetime=2015-02-05T19:00&duration=10

param.name: pos
param.description: Fragment start time. Can be: date/time in ISO format, server time zone (example: 2015-02-20T19:00), milliseconds since epoch (1970-01-01 00:00, UTC) or microseconds since epoch

group.groupDescription: This group contains information requests proxy from one server to another

function.name: <protocol>/<serverGuid>/<apiRequest>
function.description: Proxy methods allows to send any request to any server using the existing public connection. Can also be used to get video streams. Example: rtsp://10.0.2.1/proxy/rtsp/{72934575-ceb7-54bb-23a0-84b81cf1d3f1}/12AB42FD5912?pos=1235631&resolution=240p Example: http://10.0.2.1/proxy/http/{72934575-ceb7-54bb-23a0-84b81cf1d3f1}/showLog

result.caption: Return result of the target api request.

group.groupDescription: Request authentication methods supported by server

function.name: HTTP Basic / Digest Authentication
function.description: Server is fully conformant with authentication defined in rfc2617 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2617)

function.name: Cookie-based Authentication
function.description:
Cookie authorisation scheme allows to avoid standard login/password dialog in web-applications. It provides you a way to replace it with your own. It works mostly like sessions, but a bit more secure because it doesn't send user's password over HTTP.
In the first request to server you must send cookie Authorization=Digest (path: '/') You can request any anonymous request like '/api/moduleInformation'
In response you'll get cookies 'realm' and 'nonce' (nonce is a session key for this user)
Calculate digest signature: (login must be in lower case) digest = MD5(login + ':' + realm + ':' + password) method = MD5("GET:") auth = MD5(digest + ':' + nonce + ':' + method);
Set cookies: response=auth and username=login (path: '/') Every following request to server must contain cookies: username, nonce, response, Authorization

function.name: Providing Authentication Hash In Request Url
function.description:
You can add "auth" field to url query section. E.g., http://127.0.0.1:7001/ec2/getMediaServersEx?auth=auth_digest "auth_digest" is calculated in a following way: auth_digest = base64(username:nonce:simplified_ha2) simplified_ha2 = MD5(ha1:nonce:MD5(method:)) ha1 = MD5(usename:realm:password)
Current server time MUST be used as a nonce value. So, to get realm and nonce call /gettime. Such nonce value is valid for 5 minutes.
